intro: Oeosporangium viride, commonly known as green spore-bearing plant, is a unique organism belonging to the phylum Glomeromycota. It is characterized by its greenish coloration, which is due to the presence of chlorophyll, allowing it to perform photosynthesis. This plant forms symbiotic relationships with the roots of various plants, contributing to nutrient uptake. Its spores are produced in specialized structures called sporangia, which are typically found in soil. Oeosporangium viride plays a significant role in soil fertility and ecosystem health.
